intro: Lithospermum diffusum, commonly known as broadleaf lithosperm, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a hairy texture, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. The roots of Lithospermum diffusum contain various bioactive compounds, making it of interest in traditional medicine.
